page.title: 05RECREATION GROUND
page.content: My{walk}to the Rec. is across the fields I pass a very big and beautiful Oak tree it is about a hundred years old, the hedge is prickly with haw- thorn and blackberry brambles, hazel too edges the over-grown pathway. Here you will find camps and trees, swings, a slide and a see-saw, the cricket square, football pitches in winter and a stoolball pitch in the summer. Teas are served to the players in the pavilion and there are changing rooms too. The young Farmer's hold an annual barbecue and a Fete. We have our School Sports Day in the Rec. when Mums and Dads come to cheer us. If you walk a little further there is a bumpy patch that leads to where cars can be parked. There is a round wood with lots of different trees like Ash, Elm and Oak.
